questions.question: Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?

learningResources.studyTip: Mars appears red due to iron oxide (rust) on its surface
learningResources.reference: NASA's Mars exploration missions have revealed detailed information about the planet's composition

questions.question: Who was the first human to walk on the Moon?

learningResources.studyTip: Remember the famous quote: 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind'
learningResources.reference: Apollo 11 mission landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969

questions.question: What is the name of NASA's most famous space telescope?

learningResources.studyTip: The Hubble Space Telescope has been operating since 1990 and has captured stunning images of deep space
learningResources.reference: Named after astronomer Edwin Hubble, it orbits Earth at about 547 kilometers above the surface

questions.question: Which planet has the most moons in our solar system?

learningResources.studyTip: Saturn has over 80 confirmed moons, with Titan being the largest
learningResources.reference: Saturn's moon count continues to grow as new discoveries are made through advanced telescopes

learningResources.studyTip: The ISS is a collaborative project between multiple space agencies including NASA, Roscosmos, ESA, JAXA, and CSA
learningResources.reference: The ISS orbits Earth approximately every 90 minutes at an altitude of about 400 kilometers

questions.question: Which company became the first private company to send astronauts to the ISS?

learningResources.studyTip: SpaceX's Crew Dragon capsule successfully transported NASA astronauts in 2020
learningResources.reference: This marked the beginning of commercial crew transportation to the ISS

questions.question: What is the closest star to Earth (other than the Sun)?

learningResources.studyTip: Proxima Centauri is about 4.24 light-years away from Earth
learningResources.reference: It's a red dwarf star and part of the Alpha Centauri star system

questions.question: Which rover is currently exploring Mars as of 2024?

learningResources.studyTip: Perseverance landed on Mars in February 2021 and is searching for signs of ancient life
learningResources.reference: The rover also carries the Ingenuity helicopter, which achieved the first powered flight on another planet
